title: What is the new Justin Bieber’s song “yummy” really about? - Quora

response.answer_text: The song is about his wife Hailey Baldwin. Starting with the chorus: Yeah, you got that yummy-yumThat yummy-yum, that yummy-yummyYeah, you got that yummy-yumThat yummy-yum, that yummy-yummySay the word, on my wayYeah babe, yeah babe, yeah babeAny night, any daySay the word, on my wayYeah babe, yeah babe, yeah babeIn the mornin’ or the lateSay the word, on my way Right off the bat, we know Justin’s talking about either a 24-hour drive-through he can hit up at all hours of the day OR, more logically, his wife. Then he gets into a popular metaphor: Bona fide stallionAin’t in no stable, no, you stay on the runAin’t on the side, you’re number oneYeah, every time I come around, you get it done (you get it done) It seems that Justin’s comparing 5'7" Hailey to a stallion here. If you’re not obsessed with Megan Thee Stallion or from the South, you might not know that stallion is slang for a “tall, fine girl,” according to Meg herself. So to Justin, Hailey = bona fide stallion. And the “ain’t on the side, you’re number one” line sounds like he’s reassuring Hailey that she’s the only woman in his life. Love to hear it. Sorry, Jelena fans, but we’re moving on! He gives a little insight into their finances and love life: Fifty-fifty, love the way you split itHundred racks, help me spend it, babeLight a match, get litty, babeThat jet set, watch the sunset kinda, yeah, yeahRollin’ eyes back in my head, make my toes curl, yeah, yeah Let’s get the obvious bit out of the way: The eyes rolling back and toes curling part is definitely about sex. Justin and Hailey were incredibly candid about their love life in a February Vogue interview, in which he said they remained celibate while they dated and God “blessed” him with Hailey because of his “good behavior.” But they are married and don’t have to think about abstaining anymore, so now we get to hear a bit about their personal life in this song. As for the “fifty-fifty, love the way you split it,” Justin’s probably talking about how Hailey has her own career and money but also helps him spend his “hundred racks.” Guess that’s important to him!
